text:
Hamilton Fish Park: A northeastern view across same to East Houston (left) and Sheriff (right) Streets. This open play area is equally divided by Willet Street which appears in the center, running from right to left. Today (1937) the northern half (immediate foreground) has been improved with a large swimming pool which was constructed by the W.P.A. under the auspices of Park Commissioner Moses.

About 1922.

Ewing Galloway.

384 (empty lot), 388-392, and 394-396 East Houston Street, north side, between Pitt and Sheriff Streets, showing the Hamilton Fish Park branch of the New York Public Library (No. 388-392) and the Down Town Talmud Torah, a Hebrew school (No. 394-396).

January 17, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Tenements & storefronts; Hamilton Fish Park Restaurant : 131-135 Pitt St-E. Houston-Stanton, Manhattan
Tenements & storefronts; Hamilton Fish Park Restaurant, Scher Glass: 135-139 Pitt St.-E. Houston-Stanton, Manhattan
